title: ‘Arctic Drift’ Review: In Search of Cold, Hard Facts
sub_head: This ‘Nova’ entry on PBS tracks an international band of scientists whose research ship, the Polarstern, is locked in the ice for a year while they go about testing and assessing their surroundings while dodging polar bears
body: Anyone who has lived on a lake in northern North America knows about the groaning: When temperatures shift and the ice does, too, what’s heard in the night is a sound that suggests a badly played bass violin and an enormous tree cracking in the wind.
